column4: My system just restarted on its own...Im doomed :'( ... How can i see what made it restart ?
Most often, that's an ACPI issue, or a "kernel panic"
Is your system running really hot?
: How do i check the temp ? Its been running weird..
Your hand
Doesnt seem to be very hot , although i wouldnt know the difference because ive never tried before ... feels to be the same as room temperature
That looks to be a disk error.
:  So my HD = screwed ?
I would run fsck on the disk (System->Administration->Disk Utility->Select the Disk->View SMART data
Let me know if any of the assessments aren't "Good" or "N/A"
kk im on it , thx
N/A is fine
: Airflow Temperature Failed in the past ! Also , current temperature of the disk is 42 degree celsius
I would recommend checking that all of your system fans are functioning, and that you're not blocking any of the outlets on the case.
: could a VERY DUSTY Cpu be the issue ?
Yes
: So i can clean it up with a blower..hmm?
If the power supply detects that the fans aren't running, or that the hardware is overheating, it'll perform a hard shutdown of your system via ACPI
Be sure not to use a vacuum cleaner or anything with water.
Use compressed air, if possible.
: k ill check if the fans are running with a flashlight.
